intro: Pseudobastardia nemoralis, commonly known as the common false toadflax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lanceolate leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodlands and along streambanks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Pseudobastardia nemoralis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
